thread.title: NFL says it's 'monitoring the forecast,' speaking to Eagles, Redskins about weather for Sunday
thread.title_full: NFL says it's 'monitoring the forecast,' speaking to Eagles, Redskins about weather for Sunday

title: NFL says it's 'monitoring the forecast,' speaking to Eagles, Redskins about weather for Sunday
text:
NFL says it's 'monitoring the forecast,' speaking to Eagles, Redskins about weather for Sunday THE ASSOCIATED PRESS   5:24   5:24   
Organizations: 
Virginia (527) 
ASHBURN, Virginia — The NFL is keeping tabs on the potential for heavy rain that could affect the Philadelphia Eagles' game at the Washington Redskins on Sunday. 
Steady rain drenched much of the East Coast on Wednesday, and it could get stronger in parts of Virginia and Maryland in the coming days. 
The Redskins' home stadium is in Landover, Maryland 
NFL spokesman Brian McCarthy says Wednesday that the league is "closely monitoring the forecast and speaking with both teams."
